metadata.title: CVE-2023-1078 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux Kernel in RDS (Reliable Datagram Sockets)protocol. The rds_rm_zerocopy_callback() uses list_entry() on the head of alist causing a type confusion. Local user can trigger this withrds_message_put(). Type confusion leads to `struct rds_msg_zcopy_info*info` actually points to something else that is potentially controlled bylocal user. It is known how to trigger this, which causes an out of boundsaccess, and a lock corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required
